meanings.definition: Consisting of or relating to truth
meanings.sent1: The truthy statement was honest and accurate.
meanings.sent2: Her truthy words reassured everyone in the room.
meanings.sent3: The truthy fact made the audience burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: His truthy explanation cleared all doubts instantly.
meanings.sent5: The truthy story left a lasting impact on the listeners.

meanings.definition: Tending to convey a misleading impression of truth
meanings.sent1: The truthy advertisement made the product seem better than it was.
meanings.sent2: She had a truthy smile that hid her true feelings.
meanings.sent3: The truthy rumor spread like wildfire through the town.
meanings.sent4: His truthy excuse fooled no one in the end.
meanings.sent5: The truthy appearance of the painting deceived many art enthusiasts.
